alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 6:50PM EDT until July 25 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL ANDROSCOGGIN COUNTY... At 650 PM EDT, Trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Downtown Lewiston and Auburn. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lewiston, Auburn, Mechanic Falls, Greene, Leeds, Minot, Sabattus, Wales, Poland and Monmouth. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
